author: China Insights-SOHTV
description: In China, a cup of milk tea can cost as little as $0.14. But behind the insanely low prices lies a hidden cost — the tears and exhaustion of young workers. This viral video shows a young employee at a popular milk tea chain breaking down in tears as endless delivery orders pour in. Meanwhile, delivery drivers race through the sweltering streets to meet strict deadlines. The real price isn’t paid at the counter — it’s paid by the overworked youth holding up the system.
title: China’s $0.14 Milk Tea Craze: The Hidden Tears of Overworked Employees #shorts

author: China Insights-SOHTV
description:
Weddings, babies, and endless red envelopes...
Gift money was supposed to be a blessing — now it's emotional blackmail.
From long-lost classmates to distant cousins, everyone’s getting married — and you’re footing the bill.
Is this tradition or a social scam?
title: Broke from Red Envelopes: Why Every Wedding in China Costs Me a Fortune｜China Insights｜
